fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.interfaces

Interface RTSchedulingI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StandardRTScheduler

    public interface RTSchedulingI
    The interface RTSchedulerI declares the real time scheduler interface used in this library to execute simulation tasks in real time simulation engine.

    Description

    This interface is meant to abstract the simulation engines from the exact implementation of the schedulers that are available to schedule tasks.

    This definition is much inspired from Java scheduled executor services.

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 2020-11-26

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      return true if the scheduler has been shut down.
      boolean isTerminated()
      return true if the scheduler has terminated its execution.

      schedule an event task on the real time scheduler.
      java.util.concurrent.Future<?> scheduleImmediate(java.lang.Runnable eventTask)
      schedule an event task on the real time scheduler for immediate execution.
      void shutdown()
      shut down the real time scheduler.
      void shutdownNow()
      shut down the real time scheduler immediately, without waiting for running tasks to finish.

    • Method Detail

      • schedule

        java.util.concurrent.ScheduledFuture<?> schedule(java.lang.Runnable eventTask,
                                                 long delay,
                                                 java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit tu)
                                          throws java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException,
                                                 java.lang.NullPointerException
        schedule an event task on the real time scheduler.

        Contract

         pre     eventTask != null
 pre     delay >= 0
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        eventTask - the task to be executed.
        delay - the delay until the task will begins its execution.
        tu - the time unit to interpret the delay.
        Returns:
        a future allowing to cancel the task.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if the task cannot be scheduled for execution.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if command is null.

 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        eventTask - the task to be executed.
        Returns:
        a future allowing to cancel the task.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException - if the task cannot be scheduled for execution.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if command is null.

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
       throws java.lang.SecurityException
        shut down the real time scheduler.

        Contract

         pre     !isShutdown()
 post    isShutdown()
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and shutting down this ExecutorService may manipulate threads that the caller is not permitted to modify because it does not hold java.lang.RuntimePermission("modifyThread"), or the security manager's checkAccess method denies access.

      • shutdownNow

        void shutdownNow()
          throws java.lang.SecurityException
        shut down the real time scheduler immediately, without waiting for running tasks to finish.

        Contract

         pre     !isShutdown()
 post    isTerminated()
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and shutting down this ExecutorService may manipulate threads that the caller is not permitted to modify because it does not hold java.lang.RuntimePermission("modifyThread"), or the security manager's checkAccess method denies access.
